A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I loved it. I consider myself a die-hard Star Wars fan\, having seen A New Hope in the theaters when I was 5 and having watched the original trilogy countless times since then. If watching the prequels was like getting pounded on the head with a blunt instrument\, watching this one was the opposite. It was a breath of fresh air. The story was the most complex and the most unintuitive of the entire set. I loved that I truly didn't know what was going to happen\, and that a few of the standard general plot patterns (e.g.\, come up with a daring\, crazy plan to which C-3P0 would give success odds of 10000 to 1\, then succeed at it) were cast aside. It made the movie more exciting.

I didn't care so much for the casino scene\, and some of the humor felt a bit heavy\, but these didn't put much of a dent in an awesome experience.

FWIW\, my son\, who's been steeped in Star Wars since birth\, loved it too and said it was his favorite.
